intro: Mathewsia boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes species such as willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its star-shaped, five-petaled flowers that bloom in shades of white and yellow. It thrives in cool, high-altitude environments with well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
